greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 5; a(n) = smallest number such that the juxtaposition a(1)a(2)...a(n) is a prime.
link: Michael S. Branicky, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..610
example: a(5) = 3 and the number 532313 is a prime.
mathematica: a[1] = 5; a[n_] := a[n] = Block[{k = 1, c = IntegerDigits @ Table[ a[i], {i, n - 1}]}, While[ !PrimeQ[ FromDigits @ Flatten @ Append[c, IntegerDigits[k]]], k += 2]; k]; Table[ a[n], {n, 63}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 05 2005 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Mar 26 2002
